org.rapla.rest.gwtjsonrpc.client.impl

Class JsonSerializer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rapla.rest.gwtjsonrpc.client.impl.JsonSerializer<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of Java class this type works on.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EnumSerializer, JavaLangString_JsonSerializer, JavaUtilDate_JsonSerializer, ListSerializer, ObjectMapSerializer, ObjectSerializer, SetSerializer, StringMapSerializer, VoidResult_JsonSerializer

    public abstract class JsonSerializer<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Converter between JSON and Java object representations.

    Implementors must provide bidirectional conversion, typically using the GWT JavaScriptObject and native JavaScript magic to read the JSON data structure.

    Most implementations are generated automatically at compile-time by the RemoteJsonServiceProxyGenerator.

      Magic constant in JSON to mean the same as Java null.

    • Method Detail

      • printJson

        public abstract void printJson(java.lang.StringBuilder sb,
             T o)
        Convert a Java object to JSON text.

        Implementations should recursively call any nested object or collection at the appropriate time to append the nested item's JSON text.

        Parameters:
        sb - the output string buffer the JSON text should be appended onto the end of.
        o - the Java instance being converted. Never null.

      • fromJson

        public abstract T fromJson(java.lang.Object o)
        Convert from JSON (stored as a JavaScriptObject) into a new Java instance.
        Parameters:
        o - the JSON object instance; typically this should be downcast to JavaScriptObject. May be null, in which case null should be returned instead of an instance.
        Returns:
        null if o was null; otherwise the new object instance with the data copied over form the JSON representation.

      • escapeString

        @Deprecated
public static final java.lang.String escapeString(java.lang.String val)
        Deprecated. Use JsonUtils.escapeValue(String)
        Utility function to convert a String to safe JSON text.

        For example, if val = "b\nb" this method returns the value "\"b\\nb\"".

        Typically called by printJson(StringBuilder, Object), or through JavaLangString_JsonSerializer.

        Parameters:
        val - string text requiring escaping support. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        a JSON literal text value, surrounded with double quotes.

      • escapeChar

        @Deprecated
public static final java.lang.String escapeChar(char c)
        Deprecated. implementation depends on private method hack. Do not use.
        Escape a single character, without double quotes surrounding it.

      • toChar

        public static final char toChar(java.lang.String val)
        Return the first character of a string, or '\0' if the string is empty.
